DOC.brief_summary: Long surgical wait-times and limited hospital capacity are common obstacles to surgical care in many countries in sub-Saharan Africa (SSA). Ambulatory surgery might offer a solution to these problems. The aim is to study the introduction of ambulatory surgery in a pediatric hospital in SSA. This is a cross-sectional descriptive study which took place over 6 months. It includes all the patients assigned to ambulatory surgery in the Pediatric University Hospital in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso.
DOC.brief_title: Anesthesia for Ambulatory Pediatric Surgery in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA)
DOC.criteria: ASA 1 status elective surgery with low potential for blood loss or severe pain, lasting less than 90 minutes whose parents could be contacted by telephone and who could return to the hospital in less than 1 hour Parents gave consent for the surgical procedure non operative patients
